Name: Requiring the police department to report on all criminal complaints and arrests.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on all criminal complaints and arrests

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Attachments.Name: Int. No. 1237-A - Fiscal Impact Statement - City Council

Summary: This bill would require the New York City Police Department (NYPD) to post on its website data related to all criminal complaints and arrests recorded by the Department since 2007. The dataset would include, among other fields: (i) the location, date, time, and nature of the offense; (ii) demographic information for victims, suspects, and arrestees; and (iii) information on whether a complaint resulted in an arrest or departmental resolution, and the date of such resolution. Further, the data would be stored permanently, in a machine-readable format, and be updated on a biannual basis.

\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows\ulnone :\par

\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\sl480\slmult1\qj\expndtw0\tab Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 14 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 14-199 to read as follows:\par
\tab\ul\'a7 14-199 Reports on criminal complaints and arrests. a. Data. The commissioner shall post on the department\rquote s website, in machine-readable format, data on all criminal complaints and arrests. \cf1 Such data shall include \cf0 a listing of each criminal complaint received on or after January 1, 2007, and for each such complaint the following information: \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 1. A randomly generated unique identification number; \par
2. The precinct in which the incident occurred;\par
3. The date and time at which the incident occurred; \par
4. A description of the incident and classification of any relevant offenses, including but not limited to: (i) a reference to all alleged violations of law that occurred; and (ii) whether the highest alleged offense was a felony, misdemeanor, or violation; \par
5. The date on which the incident was reported to police;\par
6. The suspect\rquote s perceived race, gender, and age range; \par
7. The victim\rquote s perceived race, gender, and age range, where known; \par
8. The location where the incident occurred, including latitude and longitude if available, but in all cases at least as specific as the nearest intersection;\par
9. Whether the complaint resulted in an arrest, or otherwise has been resolved by the department; \par
10. The date on which any arrest or departmental resolution of a complaint occurred; and \par
11. If an arrest occurs, the location of such arrest and the age range, race, and gender of each arrestee. \par
b. Any reporting of age ranges required by subdivision a of this section shall be in the following increments: under the age of 18, 18 - 25, 26 - 35, 36 - 40, 41 - 60, or over 60.\par
c. Website. The information required to be reported by subdivision a of this section must remain posted on the city\rquote s website indefinitely, and shall be updated on a biannual basis.   \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\tab\'a7 2. \expndtw-3 This local law takes effect 90 day after it becomes law.\par
